Plant Description: A popular houseplant with vibrant, colorful flowers, African Violets thrive in bright, indirect light and require well-drained, slightly acidic soil for healthy growth.
Known for its medicinal properties, Aloe Vera is a hardy succulent that grows best in bright, indirect light and well-drained cactus/succulent soil for optimal growth.
With its glossy red or white spathes, Anthurium is a tropical plant that prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained, slightly acidic soil for vibrant flowers.
A graceful palm with feathery fronds, Areca Palm thrives in bright, indirect light and needs well-drained potting soil for healthy growth and lush foliage.
A fern with delicate, feathery foliage, Asparagus Fern enjoys bright, indirect light and well-drained, slightly acidic soil for optimal health and rapid growth.
Known for its colorful leaves and flowers, Begonias thrive in bright, indirect light and need well-drained, slightly acidic soil for continuous vibrant blooms.
This striking plant has large, tropical leaves and requires bright, indirect light and well-drained potting soil to grow and develop stunning flowers over time.
A fern with glossy, arching fronds, Bird's Nest Fern prefers low to medium light and rich, well-drained soil for ideal growth and lush, green foliage.
Known for its lush, feathery fronds, Boston Fern thrives in indirect light and needs rich, well-drained soil for healthy, full, and vibrant foliage year-round.
A striking plant with vibrant patterned leaves, Calathea prefers low to medium light and moist, well-draining soil to grow successfully and maintain stunning foliage.
Cast Iron Plant is known for its resilience and tolerance to low light. It grows well in well-drained potting soil, making it an excellent, low-maintenance houseplant.
A tough, low-maintenance plant, Chinese Evergreen thrives in low to bright indirect light and well-drained, slightly acidic soil, perfect for beginners.
With its round, coin-shaped leaves, Chinese Money Plant thrives in bright, indirect light and well-drained potting soil, making it a popular choice for home decor.
Unlike other cacti, Christmas Cactus enjoys bright, indirect light and well-drained, slightly acidic soil for a colorful display of blooms during the holiday season.
Known for its bright, colorful flowers, Chrysanthemums need full sun and well-drained, rich soil to bloom profusely, especially during the fall months.
This ornamental plant has beautiful, patterned leaves and grows best in low to medium light with moist, well-draining soil to preserve its stunning foliage and color.
Daffodils are cheerful, spring-blooming flowers that thrive in full sun and well-drained soil, adding vibrant color to any garden or indoor space during the season.
A popular houseplant with long, slender leaves, Dracaena grows best in indirect light and requires well-drained potting soil for easy care and minimal maintenance.
Dumb Cane has striking, variegated leaves and prefers low to bright indirect light with well-drained potting soil for successful growth and attractive foliage.
Known for its large, dramatic leaves, Elephant Ear thrives in bright, indirect light and needs moist, well-draining soil to support its bold, tropical appearance.
A fast-growing vine, English Ivy thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers well-drained potting soil, making it ideal for hanging baskets and decorative arrangements.
With its fragrant, colorful flowers, Hyacinths bloom best in full sun and well-drained soil, adding a sweet fragrance and beautiful color to any indoor or outdoor space.
Iron Cross Begonia is known for its distinctive leaf pattern and thrives in bright, indirect light with well-drained, slightly acidic soil for optimal growth.
A hardy succulent with thick, glossy leaves, Jade Plant requires bright, indirect light and a cactus/succulent soil mix to grow well and maintain its thick foliage.
Kalanchoe is a flowering succulent that thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers a cactus/succulent soil mix for healthy growth and colorful blooms year-round.
Known for its beautiful trumpet-shaped flowers, Lilium grows best in full sun and well-drained, slightly acidic soil to produce large, fragrant blooms during spring.
This fragrant spring-blooming plant prefers low to medium light and grows best in moist, well-draining soil, perfect for adding beauty to shaded areas.
Money Tree is a popular plant believed to bring good luck. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-drained potting soil for growth and longevity.
Monstera, with its large, perforated leaves, thrives in bright, indirect light and prefers peat-based potting mix for healthy growth and striking foliage indoors.
Orchids are known for their beautiful, delicate flowers and require bright, indirect light and well-draining orchid mix to thrive, making them ideal for indoor decor.
This palm is an excellent indoor plant, thriving in low to medium light with well-drained potting soil, ideal for apartments and small spaces with indirect sunlight.
Peace Lily, known for its elegant white flowers, prefers low to medium light and moist, well-draining soil to thrive and purify the air in homes and offices.
With its bright red bracts, Poinsettia thrives in bright, indirect light and well-drained, slightly acidic soil, adding festive cheer during the holiday season.
Known for its colorful, speckled leaves, Polka Dot Plant thrives in bright, indirect light and well-drained, slightly acidic soil for vibrant growth and foliage.
A striking plant with a bulbous base and long, graceful leaves, Ponytail Palm prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained potting soil for robust, healthy growth.
Pothos is a popular, easy-to-care-for vine that grows well in bright, indirect light and requires well-drained potting soil for rapid growth and lush trailing vines.
Prayer Plant has vibrant foliage and prefers low to medium light, with moist, well-draining soil for lush, colorful leaves that fold up at night like hands in prayer.
Known for its unique foliage pattern, Rattlesnake Plant thrives in low to medium light and moist, well-draining soil to maintain its stunning, vibrant foliage year-round.
Rubber Plant has large, glossy leaves and thrives in bright, indirect light with well-drained potting soil for optimal health and lush, green foliage.
Despite being called a palm, Sago Palm is a cycad that prefers bright, indirect light and well-drained potting soil, growing slowly but surely over time.
Schefflera, known for its glossy, umbrella-like leaves, thrives in bright, indirect light and well-drained potting soil for lush, full foliage and easy care indoors.
Snake Plant is one of the toughest houseplants, able to thrive in low to bright indirect light and requires well-drained potting mix to grow and purify indoor air.
Known for its trailing vines and vibrant purple and green leaves, Tradescantia grows well in bright, indirect light and well-drained potting soil for stunning growth.
With its striking, colorful blooms, Tulips grow best in full sun and well-drained soil, adding vibrant spring color and beauty to gardens and indoor arrangements.
A carnivorous plant known for its insect-catching traps, Venus Flytrap thrives in full sun and moist, acidic, well-drained soil for best growth and unique flower blooms.
Yucca is a hardy, drought-tolerant plant with spiky leaves, thriving in bright, indirect light and well-drained potting soil for low-maintenance care and longevity.

The ZZ Plant is a low-maintenance, drought-tolerant plant with glossy leaves. It thrives in low to bright indirect light and is known for its air-purifying qualities. Ideal for spaces with minimal care.
